required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Naproxen for Pain Control With Intrauterine Device Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Naproxen for Pain Control With Intrauterine Device Insertion: A Randomized Double-Blind Placebo Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is:
1. To evaluate whether 550 mg of naproxen sodium reduces pain scores with IUD insertion on a 0-10cm visual analogue scale compared to placebo (primary outcome).
2. To evaluate whether 550 mg of naproxen sodium reduces pain scores with tenaculum placement, uterine sounding and post-procedurally on a 0-10 cm visual analog scale compared to placebo (secondary outcomes).
3. To establish if prophylactic naproxen sodium is acceptable for routine use prior to IUD insertion.
Hypothesis: The administration of naproxen sodium, 550mg orally, 1 hour prior to IUD insertion will lead to a reduction in pain scores associated with IUD insertion compared to placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain at time of IUD insertion using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after IUD insertion is complete
primary_outcome.description: Pain at time of IUD insertion will be measured immediately upon completion of IUD insertion using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain with tenaculum placement using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after tenaculum is placed on cervix
secondary_outcome.description: Pain with tenaculum placement will be measured immediately after tenaculum is placed on the cervix using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain with uterine sounding using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain with uterine sounding will be measured immediately after uterine sounding using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain 5 minutes after IUD insertion using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Five minutes after IUD insertion is complete
secondary_outcome.description: Pain 5 minutes after IUD insertion will occur five minutes after IUD insertion is complete using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain 15 minutes after IUD insertion using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Fifteen minutes after IUD insertion is complete
secondary_outcome.description: Pain 15 minutes after IUD insertion will occur 15 minutes after IUD insertion is complete using a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS)

intervention.description: 550 mg, oral, on day 1. Number of Cycles: 1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 years or older
- Premenopausal
- Presenting for insertion of any IUD type (i.e. Mirena, Paragard, Skyla)
- English-speaking or non-English speaking with appropriate translator available
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently pregnant or pregnant within the last 4 weeks
- Not eligible for IUD insertion per PPLM's clinical protocols
- Presenting for IUD removal and reinsertion
- Any diagnosis of chronic pain (including fibromyalgia, endometriosis, dysmenorrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, interstitial cystitis)
- Pain medications taken within 12 hours of enrollment
- Misoprostol usage within 24 hours of enrollment
- Any known allergy or contraindication to non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (including active renal disease, active hepatic disease, gastric ulcer disease or gastritis, and bleeding disorders)
